Package mygame.game

Class GameMap

java.lang.Object

public class GameMap
extends java.lang.Object
Class that represents a GameMap

  • Constructor Details

    • GameMap

      public GameMap()
      Constructor for the GameMap. It creates an instance of Network to represent the game map as a weighted directed graph. It also creates an instance of ArrayUnorderedList to list all players in-game

  • Method Details

    • getMap

      public Network<Local> getMap()
      Getter for the map
      Returns:
      Network

    • addLocation

      public void addLocation​(Local local)
      Adds a new location to the GameMap
      Parameters:
      local - location to add

    • removeLocation

      public void removeLocation​(Local local)
      Removes an existing location from the GameMap
      Parameters:
      local - location to be removed

    • editLocation

      public void editLocation​(Local local)
      Edits an existing location of the GameMap. It prompts the user with questions on the terminal, so that the user is able to choose which parameters to edit
      Parameters:
      local - location to be edited

    • listLocations

      public void listLocations()
      TODO: sorting here

    • getLocalByID

      public Local getLocalByID​(int id)
      Fetches an existing location from the GameMap by its ID
      Parameters:
      id - identification number of the location
      Returns:
      location to be fetched

    • getShortestPathToLocal

      public ArrayUnorderedList<Local> getShortestPathToLocal​(int startID, int targetID)
      Gets the shortest path between two locations
      Parameters:
      startID - location of origin
      targetID - location of destination
      Returns:
      list of locations to go through

    • getShortestPathBetweenMultipleLocals

      public ArrayUnorderedList<Local> getShortestPathBetweenMultipleLocals​(int... localIDs)
      Gets the shortest path between multiple locations. Best used when it's required to calculate the shortest path, whilst forcefully passing through specific locations
      Parameters:
      localIDs - locations to be included on the path. Origin and destination included
      Returns:
      list of locations to go through

    • connectLocations

      public void connectLocations​(Local location1, Local location2, double weight)
      Connects two existing locations on the GameMap
      Parameters:
      location1 - first location
      location2 - second location
      weight - path distance of the locations to connect

    • connectLocationsWithCoordinates

      public void connectLocationsWithCoordinates​(Local location1, Local location2)
      Connects two existing locations on the GameMap. The method automatically adds the path distance, which is calculated using the locations's coordinates
      Parameters:
      location1 - first location
      location2 - second location

    • removeConnectingPath

      public void removeConnectingPath​(int firstLocalID, int secondLocalID)
      Removes a connection path between two locations
      Parameters:
      firstLocalID - first location
      secondLocalID - second location

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Lists all the information relative to the GameMap
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      String of all the information

    • getShortestPathWeight

      public double getShortestPathWeight​(int start, int target)
      Gets the shortest path weight between two locations using their IDs
      Parameters:
      start - ID of the location of origin
      target - ID of the location of destination
      Returns:
      shortest path weight

    • getShortestPathWeightBetweenMultipleLocals

      public double getShortestPathWeightBetweenMultipleLocals​(int... locals)
      Gets the shortest path weight between multiple locations using their IDs. Best used when calculating the shortest path between two locations, whilst forcefully passing throw specific locations
      Parameters:
      locals - locations to pass through
      Returns:
      shortest path weight
